meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tame.
meanings.sent1: The tameness of the pet rabbit made it easy to handle.
meanings.sent2: The tameness of the lion surprised the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent3: The tameness of the squirrel led to it stealing nuts from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: The tameness of the puppy was like a warm blanket on a cold night.
meanings.sent5: The tameness of the horse made it a joy to ride in the meadow.

meanings.definition: The act or process of making something tame.
meanings.sent1: Her tameness of the wild horse took months of patient training.
meanings.sent2: The tameness of the stray cat was achieved through gentle care and feeding.
meanings.sent3: The tameness of the mischievous raccoon was a result of clever tricks and treats.
meanings.sent4: The tameness of the fierce wolf was a testament to the power of human kindness.
meanings.sent5: The tameness of the wild bird was a triumph of patience and perseverance.
